private_information: I hold the full stack of disks ordered top-to-bottom as A, B, C, D, E, F, G
I can only move the top disk that is currently on me
left_peg.goal: Move the entire stack from left to right following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I can temporarily hold disks as long as larger disks are never placed on smaller ones
middle_peg.goal: Assist in moving the stack from left to right following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I will be the target peg for the full stack ordered top-to-bottom as A, B, C, D, E, F, G
right_peg.goal: Receive the entire stack from left to right following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I coordinate the agents and assemble their local reports into a global plan
I must output a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward planner
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance moving all disks from left to right under the rules

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks labelled A smallest to G largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk can never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G top to bottom. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg should have disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G top to bottom, left and middle pegs empty.

report_state.system_prompt: You represent the left peg. Provide a concise report of your local state and legal local moves. Do not emit PDDL.
report_state.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information} Your goal is: {agents->left_peg->goal} Describe your current stack top-to-bottom, list which disk you can move (the top disk), and enumerate legal target pegs for that disk given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Provide only a structured textual report suitable for the orchestrator to consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing problems for the FastDownward planner. Using the local state reports from the pegs, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance and is solvable by FastDownward. Use STRIPS-compatible constructs where possible and keep actions explicit for moving a single disk from one peg to another while enforcing the size constraint. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The output should be ready for FastDownward without further modification.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information} You received these local reports: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} Your goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the peg reports into a single PDDL domain and problem that defines objects for the disks and pegs, predicates to describe which disk is on which peg and which disk is on top of which disk, and actions that move the top disk between pegs with preconditions and effects that enforce legal moves. Ensure the problem encodes the initial distribution and the goal distribution. Target the FastDownward planner and provide the domain and problem enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
